Name: Superbloom
Description:
Superbloom is an abstract game where players work to maximize the prominence of their preferred color of wildflowers.

Flower placement is governed by a handful of simple rules with players scoring points throughout the game.  At game end - either through card exhaustion or board completion - additional scoring is performed based on secret wagers.

—description from the designer

Name: Byggare Bob: Ett jobb för Byggare Bob
Description:
It´s an snake and ladder kind of boardgame. 
The object of the game is to navigate one's game piece, according to die rolls, from the start (bottom square) to the finish (top square), helped or hindered by Bob the Builder. You can get a green light and go forward two steps. There is a square that tells you that you have forgotten your builderhelmet, so you have to go back three steps. There can be workers on the road that make you skip you turn. There are several ( I think 7) different types of squares that you can end up on, that makse you go forward och backwards. First up wins the game.

Name: Tight Red Pants: The Card Game
Description:
Crystopolis is ravaged by crime! Arch villains rule the streets, making life downright miserable and dangerous for our good citizens. Their only hope is a small band of local residents, dedicated to upholding the law, protecting the public and banishing the evil, marauding monsters from this once great city.

No-one knows the true identities of these local heroes (except for Mrs McGinty, who knits their superhero outfits) and you, a member of the Tight Red Pants Alliance.

It's time to pull them up, and take them down! The villains that is. Tight Red Pants is a simple to play, fun super hero battling card game that will keep your little heroes and grown up ones entertained for hours. Comes with everything you need to play including the world's first flat dice! A game for 2-4 people aged 8 plus

How to play Tight Red Pants the game

You control a bunch of home grown heroes and have to save the General Public (GPs) from evil villains before Teatime. The game ends when either: The Teatime card turns up 3 times or if all four locations are out with one villain and one GP or one hero wins 5 battles

When setting up you remove the dice card and put all the green bus stop (GP cards) to one side, public side down. Choose a location card and place face up on the table. Shuffle the rest and deal three hand cards face down to each player, then place the remaining cards face down as the draw pile. Shuffle and use again when depleted. The discard pile will go next to this.

Play. On your go pick up one card and play as many hand cards as you wish. Do not hold more than five. ‘Red Pant’ cards are always played or discarded if no effect. Play goes clockwise

MAKING A SCENE. As you lay cards fights break out all over the city (table) but first you need a location card then a villain and finally one GP from the bus stop. Place this on the location. This scene is then complete

HOW TO FIGHT VILLAINS. Players then (on their go) use any hero in their hand to fight that baddie. Defeat the villain to collect and save the GP cards to eventually win the game. Save your GPs to one side. If you play all your cards pick up another three and have one more go. Move on after one fight.

PUNCH-UP Process Once a location, a villain and some GPs are in place any hero can battle the villain. Use the Dice Card to fight, adjust the stats for any item or henchmen cards added.

Note these stats down before fighting on the score pad.

Now try to roll your Attack or below to hit. If you do, then roll again for damage to reduce the villain’s HPs to zero. Villains then roll in the same way. Ask another player to roll for them. Continue until either is defeated. If you win you get to keep the GPs, if you lose the villain stays on play and another GP is added to scene. You go is over.

The game continues in the same way each player challenging the villains at the locations. Collect and use your item cards to help your heroes and eventually the tea time will turn up 3 times.

Then it's game over. The player with the most GPs wins or nobody wins if the villains overrun the city

—description from the designer

Name: Escape Game
Description: Find the code to open the electronic lock. To do this, solve the puzzle by finding the 3 good indices on the chips (color, object and food). You will need for this the help of your detective tools: black light, red filter, mirror.

Name: WWII Tank Leader Commander Cards
Description:
From the publisher website:
For Sherman or Tiger Leader
Historical Enemy Commanders to give the enemy unique combat abilities! Commanders for the U.S., U.K., Russia, Germany, France, and Poland.

Name: Cookies
Description: Delicious cookies can be yours for the eating, but first you have to bake them! Play against the clock: Can you make four kinds of cookies before time runs out? Cookies is a cooperative game of baking cookies that includes a 3D oven!

Name: Dragorun
Description:
On your marks, get set, race! When Danny, Didi, Diego, Dragma and Dragobert, the terrors of all terrors, head down to the race track in Dragorun, things are getting tense. Which dragon should you bet on? Who will triumph in this race full of surprising twists?

—description from the publisher

Name: BeerIQ
Description:
Beer IQ is a beer-themed trivia party game that features 400 multiple-choice questions covering beer history and lore, with answers adding or subtracting IQ points from your score. A two-round format favors learning; the first tests your knowledge, while the second tests your memory, giving novices a chance to challenge seasoned hop heads.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sussed?: Emotional Intelligence
Description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including what makes you happy, angry, interested, afraid, strong, disgusted, relaxed, jealous, trustworthy, lazy and curious (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

Name: Sussed?: Lifeology
Description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Name: Wojowoce
Description:
A simple card game about fruit warriors

Players compete in creating unique fruit cocktails. They use the unique skills of brave fruit fighters to make their own cocktail even better or spoil your opponents. Every Wojowoc is different and unique in its own way. Only a clever combination of their capabilities will give this unique effect that you are looking for. Wojowoce, is a simple card game that gives so many possibilities during the game, that will provide a lot of fruity fun for dozens of games.

Create the best fruit cocktail and do not be outdone by other players.

The game in "Wojowoce" begins with preparing the deck for the game. For the game, we choose one deck more than we have players at the table (there are a total of 6 decks in the game). Cards are mixed, we give away to players, and among the last cards we place the Heat card signaling the end of the party.

During the game, we play the card, effect it, place it in our game area (cocktail) in the same color fruit column and draw 1 card from the general deck (basket). There are four types of card effects in the game - attack, power (immediate effect), effect (permanent effect) and the reaction that we can play in response to the opponent's attack.

At the moment of getting the advantage over the opponents in the number of fruits in one color, we obtain a corresponding card providing additional points, however this bonus is transitive and we can lose it along with the loss of advantage for another player.

The game ends with a round after drawing the Heat card from the deck. At the end of the game, we count points on the cards in our Cocktail, points from the above-mentioned bonus cards for the advantage and after point for each card in hand. The player with the highest number of victory points won wins.

				
				
					POLISH VERSION BELOWProsta gra karciana o owocowych wojownikach

Name: A Game of Legacy
Description:
Kickstarter game designed by Bernie DeKoven and Tassos Stevens, exploring the nature of legacy and "evoking what it means to pass something on to someone else", created following de Koven's terminal cancer diagnosis in 2017.

The game arrives in a sealed box, with instructions not to open it until the players are ready to play. The game states that it requires a box of matches or a lighter, and a device with internet access.

Name: Zombie in My Pocket: Masque maya
Description:
Expansion for Zombie in my pocket.

'Mayan Mask' promo card is shuffled in with the other Event cards

This card has the effect of announcing the end of the world on 21/12/2012, according to a Mayan prophecy.

The rules to the cards:

When the current group leader chooses the 'explorer' action, he places a new 'Location' card and moves the group to it or moves it to a 'Location' card already visited.

Then he has to solve an event. He draws a card from the top of the Event stack. If this is the Maya Mask card and the current time is:
- 21h, nothing happens, he discards the card.
- 22h, nothing happens, he discards the card.
- 23h, the effect 'Mask Maya' applies. Each fighter loses his life points and the game has won

Name: Tank Leader Terrain Tile Pack
Description:
Expansion pack for Sherman and Tiger Leader games.

This expansion includes Terrain Tiles for Europe, Winter, Desert, and Jungle. It also includes 4 new Terrain types: Roads, Rivers, Bogging, and Outposts and a rules sheet for new terrain types.

This new terrain will allow for different scenario layouts in either the Sherman Leader or Tiger Leader games.

Name: Antsy!
Description:
A Fast-paced fun game to get rid of "those ants in the pants."

Each player is assigned a pair of pants on the game board. They are also given 10 ants to put in their pants. The players then move around the board and are given activities which help get rid of the ants.

The first player to "get rid of" their ants wins the game. The game plays fast and children want to play Antsy time after time.

Name: Red Flags: Expansion One
Description:
Have your terrible dates fallen into a stale routine? With this general Red Flags Expansion, you can re-live that first magical moment, and fall in love with your terrible dates all over again.

Red Flags: Expansion One adds 75 perks and Red Flags to your game.

Name: Hood's Last Gamble
Description:
1864. After some maneuvering in northern Georgia in an attempt to disrupt Sherman's supply line, John Bell Hood moved the Confederate Army of Tennessee westward and then to the north. George Thomas's Army of the Cumberland, which was dispersed but growing, stood in the way. Hood's plan had objectives such as defeating scattered Union armies, bringing in thousands of recruits from Tennessee, taking the city of Nashville, and after that even moving into Kentucky and beyond. These goals were optimistic in the face of Federal strength, but Hood was determined to gamble…

Hood's Last Gamble is an operational-level game for two players exploring the 1864 Franklin-Nashville Campaign. It shares some similarities with the designer's earlier games More Aggressive Attitudes and Objective Shreveport!, but has its own identity and flavor. This one has a larger map with many tricky terrain challenges and more Special Event Cards around which to build your strategy. It utilizes a streamlined approach to the tracking of unit Strength Points that reduces counter clutter and allows for more elegant hidden movement opportunities. Supply counters are crucial to getting the most out of your units, and with winter just around the corner, the Confederate Player must act quickly and decisively in order to change history.

Name: Outlive: Leader – Greg & Emmy
Description:
A Promotional Card Offering 1 new Leader: "Greg & Emmy". Available on Day 13 of the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018.

(Probably a portrait of the designer himself?)

This new character offers the following advantage: "start the game with a second room built for free".

In 1918, newly independent Finland is in turmoil. The Senate and the Parliament are paralyzed, restless Russian troops are still stationed all over the country, and pro-government and revolutionary paramilitaries are clashing. The Senate flees the troubles from the capital to the north, while its army, the White Guard, starts to disarm Russian garrisons. At the same time in the capital, the People's Delegation declares a revolution and its Red Guard starts to seize power in southern Finland.

In more detail, 1918 is a two-player strategy game of the Finnish civil war. Players are in control of the pro-government Whites and the revolutionary Reds and their respective allies. All factions are unique with different kind of units, creating asymmetrical but balanced gameplay. The game has three scenarios, with different set-ups, objectives, and durations that depict different stages of war. In addition, there is the Grand Campaign, covering the whole war.

Rather than simulating mere fighting and battles, 1918 combines combat, type and quality of units, supply, casualties and fog of war into more complex warfare. On a strategic level, players have to create and maintain an army, keep an eye on the enemy, and secure their supply routes. On a operational level, players must take into account different kind of terrain and infrastructure affecting battles, in addition to their fighting forces.

All factions differ from one another. Factions also differ in every scenario or campaign, both by units available and the phase they come into play. Different objects of scenarios also change the entire way of playing with different sides.

Set-ups, units, and objectives of each scenario and the campaign are converted from real events and situations of the Finnish Civil War. Also each sides' support in the country, their means of support, and the infrastructure and the terrain are taken from respective real-life equivalents.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: General's Handbook
Description:
This book expands the Warhammer: Age of Sigmar miniatures war game.

It contains description of the three different ways to play: Open Play, Narrative Play and Matched Play

Open Play: 

     Battleplans for multi-player games.


Narrative Play: 

     Path to Glory - campaigns with warbands tables and battleplans
     Map campaigns
     Tree Campaigns with Battleplans.
     Matrix Campaigns


Matched Play

     Ladder Campaigns
     Rules for Pitched Battles.
     6 Battleplans
     Pitched Battle Profiles: List of point values for most units and battalions. Including the so called Compendium of the old armies, (i.e. Tomb Kings.)


Allegiance Abilities

    for the four Grand Alliances: Order, Chaos, Death and destruction


The Original Rules.

-From the list of contents

Name: Ark Worlds
Description:
A two-player skirmish game inspired by MOBAs and hero-based team shooters, Ark Worlds takes an approach that simplifies the laning in MOBAs and emphasizes the team fight in order to gain strategic advantage.

In Ark Worlds, you gather a team of six heroes, then each player deploys four heroes per engagement, with players activating abilities back and forth until all actions have been exhausted. The team with the highest total dominance when the dust clears controls the objective. This game appeals to people who like the game play of Magic: The Gathering or Netrunner but do not want to sift through hundreds of cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mixed Signals: The Circuit Board Game
Description:
Mixed Signals: The Circuit Board Game is a game in which two players compete for the domination of a circuit board.

The players play as low and high voltage (or zeroes and ones if you prefer) and take turns placing triangular circuit tiles on the board. This in an effort to cause favorable voltage transitions in the circuit.

The goal for each player is to place all of their voltage tokens on the board by getting a majority of the circuit to carry their voltage. This is not as easy as it might sound since your opponent can and will hijack your sections of the circuit!

The game starts out with only two input tiles, one carrying a low voltage and one carrying a high voltage. Throughout the game, you will find signal mixing tiles and even new input tiles that make the game increasingly challenging, complex and fun!

Name: Into the Black: Boarding Party – Increased Crew
Description:
When it comes to boarding unknown starships it really helps to bring even more friends!

Increase your boarding party, and chances of survival, with the
Into the Black: Boarding Party 5 to 6 Player Expansion!

--

Into the Black: Boarding Party is a semi-cooperative space pirate dungeon crawl with a hidden traitor element.

Play as a fierce band of space pirates who have boarded an enemy vessel, set on accomplishing your primary mission while each pirate has their own secret goal to fulfill.

Explore the ship one section at a time, loot the vessel of its bounty, fend off a seemingly unending wave of enemy defenders and encounter a potentially lethal series of events around every corner; All while keeping morale high as the clock ticks down to your potential capture.

Be wary of the the traitor among you, out for personal glory at the expense of the rest of the crew!

Will you make it off the ship with all of your goals accomplished and your crew intact? Find out in Into the Black: Boarding Party!

Name: Into the Black: Boarding Party – EPIC Encounters
Description:
Just when you thought you had this, that this boarding was like a walk in the park, suddenly you can feel something ominous approaching. Who, or what, could it be? Will it be friend or foe?

Find out with the Into the Black: Boarding Party EPIC ENCOUNTERS Expansion!

Face fearsome enemies or earn their favour and loyalty.
Collect epic loot to improve your chances of survival and fame.

--

Into the Black: Boarding Party is a semi-cooperative space pirate dungeon crawl with a hidden traitor element.

Play as a fierce band of space pirates who have boarded an enemy vessel, set on accomplishing your primary mission while each pirate has their own secret goal to fulfill.

Explore the ship one section at a time, loot the vessel of its bounty, fend off a seemingly unending wave of enemy defenders and encounter a potentially lethal series of events around every corner; All while keeping morale high as the clock ticks down to your potential capture.

Be wary of the the traitor among you, out for personal glory at the expense of the rest of the crew!

Will you make it off the ship with all of your goals accomplished and your crew intact? Find out in Into the Black: Boarding Party!

Name: Vengeance: Big Boss and Gambling Dens
Description:
Big Boss Dens come into play when a Big Boss is discovered.  Each gang have their own Big Boss Den that is designed for the abilities and flavor of that specific gang.  Big Boss Dens are tough to beat, but reward the player with more victory points and wild tokens than even the toughest dens in a standard game of Vengeance.

Gambling Dens add a further challenge in your quest for vengeance in the form of fortified doors.  Fortified doors make it harder to move through and block shooting for both you and the baddies.  But for the deft ones that infilitrate them, there's more wild tokens to be had.

Big Boss and Gambling Dens increase the difficulty of a game of Vengeance while rewarding players if they overcome them.

Name: Dungeon Crawler: Unbound Delve Pack 1 – Keldorna
Description:
To expand your collection further you can pick up one of the five Delve Packs. These non-random packs contain 52 cards, now printed in the USA, with new Adventurers, Quests and a mix of new cards and useful copies of cards from the Unbound Starter to bolster both your Dungeon and your Crawler decks. There is Keldorna (filled with traps), Stonehold (focusing on Undead and Goblins), Outlands (focusing on terrain), Sylvan Woods (focusing on poison), and Barren Mountains (focusing on Stealth and big monsters). The Delve Packs have been reconstructed as v2.0 to work better with 1 full set games instead of a randomized format intended for up to 4 copies of the game. Check the specific game format rules to see limitations on how many copies of each card you can have in a deck.

—description from the publisher

Description:

Source: Gifted Vision (Publisher)

Name: Vengeance: Hero Pack – Meatboy Murphy
Description:
Dylan "Meatboy: Murphy was a contender for the Pro-Wrestling title two years in a row.  He lost both fights.  He never got over it.  When the Zuce Clan offered him a nice retirement package to throw a fight against their boy Vlad, he agreed, only to hammer the serb into the mat within one round.  He just couldn't help himself.  Needles to say Don Zemun was not amused.  That was the end of Meatboy's fighting career...
...well almost.

The Meatboy Murphy Hero Pack includes all you need to add the erratic but unyielding hero to a game of Vengeance.  This includes the sculpted Meatboy Murphy miniature, hero board, 9 montage cards and Meatboy's solo mission card.

Name: Goosebumps: The Card Game of Monster Mayhem
Description:
Goosebumps: The Card Game of Monster Mayhem is a furious battle between monsters. Giant Mantis versus Werewolf. Slappy versus the Mummy. This easy and fun card game uses different characteristics to determine which monster will come out on top. Features large oversized cards with art from the Scholastic books.

Shuffle the monster cards, Slappy card, and Mastermind card together and deal all 60 cards. All players place their cards face down in a draw pile in front of them.

The game is played in 6 rounds. In each round, players battle their monsters to win a trophy. Trophies are awarded in the same order as outlined on the monster cards. Ie: in round 1, players only use the Strength ability when battling each other.

Player 1 takes the top card from their draw pile, places the card face up on the table, and declares either “high” or “low”. All the other players flip over their top card and place them face up on the table. Players now battle by comparing their monster’s ability ratings. If “high” was declared, the monster with the highest rating wins the battle. If “low” was declared, the monster with the lowest rating wins the battle.

Both Slappy and Mastermind are special cards. They have a 1 or 9 rating for all abilities (depending on whether “high” or “low” is  declared).

The player who wins the battle places all the cards from the battle into their winnings pile, and then takes the top card from their 
draw pile and declares “high” or “low” for the next battle. Play continues in this manner until all the monsters have done battle and there are no monster cards left

When the round is over, players count the number of cards in their winnings pile. The player with the most cards wins the round, and collects the corresponding trophy card.

Repeat this process 5 more rounds for the remaining abilities and award trophy cards in the same manner.

The game ends when all 6 trophies have been won. The winner is the player with the most trophies.

Name: CompoundIt!
Description:
CompoundIt! is a word game in which the “letters” are chemical elements and the “words” are compounds. The rules of the game strive to balance entertainment and playability, scientific accuracy, and educational value. The target audience includes students, science enthusiasts, nerds, and word game fans interested in learning an entirely new “language”. The style of play is familiar to those who have played other crossword-style board games, and the rules for compound formation come from chemistry itself.

Players make moves using a hand of ten tiles. Each tile is an element from the periodic table, although not every element is represented--only those found in relatively common compounds. A valid move creates a neutral compound with balanced charges. Compounds may be either binary (like carbon dioxide, methane, water, or ammonia) or involve polyatomic ions (sulfate, nitrate, hydroxide, etc.) Subsequent turns build new compounds using both new tiles and tiles already on the board. Players score points based on the point value of each tile (some elements are worth more than others), whether they are utilized in one direction or both horizontally and vertically, and whether they are played on special bonus squares. The game ends when one player runs out of tiles following the exhaustion of the general supply; at this time, the player with the most points wins.

Name: Brewin' USA: Taproom Takeover
Description:
The brewing industry in the USA is flourishing and taprooms are leading the way attracting customers to the site of creation for the ambitious new ales hitting the market.

Players compete to brew craft beer and fill their taproom with the best lineup of liquid gold. Taproom Takeover brings dice drafting to the world of Brewin' USA and adding new Breweries and beer cards that can play with the original Brewin' USA.

Draft an ingredient die or brew a beer if you have obtained the necessary ingredients. Stock your taproom quickly with the classic beer styles, or be the mad chemist and line the taps with experimental  brews.  When somebody has brewed 5 beers, the game ends and the highest score wins.

Players will also need to focus on expanding their taproom with more offerings to brew their 3rd, 4th, and 5th beer.  A player may spend two dice showing the Tap facing to acquire a new beer tap.  Each beer tap may have an action that the player may use on their turn as well as 1-2 beer styles and VP associated with each style.

—description from the publisher

Name: SheepDice: The Adventure
Description:
The sheep are restless… they want to go on an adventure!

SheepDice: The Adventure is a dice rolling game where the sheep are the dice. The flock of 21 sheep travel from one tile to the next until they make it back home… or not! Be a shepherd and help guide the sheep along, or be a wolf and catch them. The team with the most sheep wins!

The shepherd picks a sheep to roll, and based on the result, all matching sheep will move forward. The wolf rolls a group of sheep and catches one, but only if the wolf guesses a sheep type that ends up being alone. The tiles are double-sided and can be rearranged so you can have a different adventure every time.

Can be played in teams, cooperatively, or solo.

—description from the publisher

Name: Annihilation Zombies
Description:
Groks Games brings you a thrilling turn based card game where you and your friends fight off zombie hordes until there is only one survivor left standing. Use Ranged and Melee weapons to deal damage to the attacking zombies, but watch out, one of the other players may attempt to turn on you in an instant. Game includes over 180 cards, 2 D6 Dice, 20 Bite tokens, and the "Rules to live by" instruction booklet.

OBJECTIVE:  Be the last living Survivor. Help or betray your friends to survive and win!

SETUP: There are 3 decks. The Zombie Deck, Loot Deck, and Event Deck. Shuffle each deck and place them face down. Each Survivor (player) is dealt 5 cards from the Loot Deck for their starting hand. Now you’re ready to fight some zombies!
       
HOW TO DIE: Each time you attack a zombie and do not kill it, the zombie bites you and you receive 1 Bite Token. If you have 5 or more Bite Tokens and you have no way of healing yourself, you die and are out of the game.

THE LINE: The Line is where zombies go when they’re revealed. The Line is how you fight multiple zombies you encounter. Zombies are set one after the other in a line in the order they are revealed. When you enter your combat phase, the first zombie in the line becomes the Active Zombie. (See Combat Phase for more information.)

HOW YOUR TURN WORKS: If it is your turn, you are the Active Survivor. To start your turn you’ll encounter a zombie.

ENCOUNTER PHASE: Reveal the top card of the Zombie Deck and put it on The Line.
 PREPARATION PHASE: You have a chance to play or trade Loot Cards from your hand before engaging the Active Zombie in combat. You may also ask for help and make a Contract with any Survivor(s). (See Contracts for more information.) When you’re done preparing, move to the Combat Phase.

COMBAT PHASE:
The first zombie in The Line becomes the Active Zombie.
The Active Zombie or Event’s ability takes effect (if any).
If it is a zombie card, you may try to run. (See Running section for more information.)
If you fail to run or don’t want to, declare which weapon you're attacking with and attack the Active Zombie. (See Weapons and Combat for more information.)
Repeat this process until all of the zombies on The Line are dead and then loot their corpses.

LOOT PHASE: 
Draw Loot cards for all of the zombies you have killed. (The number of loot a zombie gives is next to the treasure chest at the bottom right corner of the Zombie card.)
Events such as Smoke Bomb and Bad Luck prevent you from receiving loot on that turn.
Running from zombies and making contracts will change how much loot you receive.
Survivors may play, trade, give away, or discard any cards they can before the end of a turn.

When the Loot Deck runs out of cards to draw, do not re-shuffle the Loot Deck. Once the loot is gone, zombies are worth zero loot and you must survive with what you have!

END OF TURN:  All Survivors must discard down to 5 cards or 10 if they have an active Backpack.

—description from the publisher

Name: 1 mal mußte: 3 mal kannste
Description:
Each player gets 6 sticks. The goal is to get rid of all 6 sticks. Each turn the players have the choice to roll 1 to 3 times. The players place a stick on the space with the number they rolled.
If the space contains a stick, the player has to take this stick instead of getting rid of one.

An exception is space 6. Every time a 6 is rolled, the player places a stick on space 6 regardless of the number of sticks already there.

The first player who hasn't any sticks left wins the game.

Name: Llamagedón
Description:
Houston, we have a problem! Meteors incoming! The llama armageddon (llamagedón in short) is coming and llamas are afraid of it. To brace themselves for the end of the world, they need to build shelters.

Llamagedón is a slightly strategic and light card game that combines mechanics such as hand management, take that and set collection. On their turn, a player draws a card from the deck. If they draw a Shelter card, then they have to play it immediately by placing it down. Shelters can also be built by combining resources. Beside playing shelters or building them, a player can use one action card which might involve attacking or stealing shelters, swapping one card for another, skipping the next player's turn, protecting your shelter, drawing two cards from the deck or even canceling the action of another player.

Eventually, a player will draw the Llamagedón card from the deck (which was randomly shuffled into the lower half of the deck) and this means everyone gets another two turns. After that, whoever has the most shelters is the winner.

The game consists of 60 cards plus 5 reference cards and it's in both Spanish and English.

If you like llamas, meteors and sheeps, then Llamagedón might be a good fit for you.

Name: Champions of Nexum
Description:
Champions of Nexum is a first truly MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) board game that will be launched on Kickstarter still this year. 
It is highly inspired by MOBA style video games.

Great emphasis was placed on cooperation within your team, which best reflects the emotions that can be found in MOBA type games.

The goal of this game is to destroy the opponent's castle. 
Which can be achieved by carrying out the quests entrusted to your team. 
In doing this, you will destroy Runic Towers and gain access to the opponent's castle.

Game offers fast and dynamic gameplay with short sessions (around one hour).

—description from the publisher

Name: Skyrim: Chapter I (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
- Wake up...
- Where am I? Why are my hands tied? And why can't I remember anything about my last time transfert?

This Time Stories fan scenario is the 1rst chapter of my SKYRIM Trilogy.
It takes place in 4E 201 in an heroic fantasy environment.

Updates:
- 28/12/2017 : V2. Major update. Improve texts. Change Places.
- 14/05/2018 : V3. Correct few typos.
- 19/07/2018 : V4. Add riddles.
- 05/09/2018 : V5. Add new riddles.
>> This scenario will not be updated anymore.

To download the scenario (PDF):
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1cZ_9ht-WSxummil7kLYrSmIW6RNhW6uk
Print it in A4, both sides of the paper.

To download the scenario (.DOCX, best quality):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mr5Zo98GeQxI__010L3oGZ8PN9I-QSZC/view?usp=sharing
Print it in A4, one sides of the paper and fold the cards.
Families: Video Game Theme: The Elder Scrolls

Name: This War of Mine: Heart of the City
Description:
Heart of the City is very special addition to the game bringing an 84mm miniature as well as additional 50 stories and 5 cards. This huge, destroyed monument will symbolize “heart” of the destroyed city, where people tend to gather and where you never know what to expect.

Mechanically, this will be a whole new location that you will be able to visit. After scavenging we will decide ourselves if we want to visit the center of the city additionally or if it's too risky, BUT you will never know what to expect there. It will not be just one-time additional exploration – in this area some of the most intense things will be happening. It can be either positive or negative, you will never know until you will decide to go there. The system will of course possess an inner balancing mechanic so there is no chance for a "festival of randomness" and drawing 4 of the worst cards or the other way around. Heart of the city will also consist of special stories for that region and we will make sure they will be very, very memorable.

'—description from the publisher
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: Snappy Maths
Description:
Snappy the crocodile is hungry! Help him catch some fishies for his lunch by matching the number of fish in the stream to earn fish tokens.

Snappy Maths is a quick-fire educational game for children, designed by a 10 year-old. Two players race to compose simple math equations (addition, subtraction and multiplication of numbers 1, 2 and 3) to match a target number determined by a six-sided die. Each of the nine cards can be used in two ways: as a number (1 to 3), or as an operator (+, - or ×) depending on which way up you place it. The first player to arrange their cards to match the target number wins the round and receives a fish token, and the first player to earn five tokens wins the game.

Name: Ein Tag mit Romika
Description: The players have to get from space 1 to space 60. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 60 wins the game.

Name: Teaser: A Game for Guides
Description:
Teaser is

        star: 44 brightly coloured games-cards on four Guiding Topics - History, International, Badges and General Knowledge
        star: 6 exciting games - some using boards, some run-around -- to test your memory and ingenuity
        star: fun at meetings and with friends
        star: a great way to learn all about Guiding


—description from the publisher

This card game from the 1980s contains trivia about The Girl Guide Movement in the United Kingdom.

Name: Urban Heat
Description: Urban Heat is a simple, press-your-luck auto racing game for 1 to 6 players. Requiring one stop on each curve, players must choose between going a safe minimum speed of three spaces or add a D6 roll to the minimum and risk a wreck. The track is randomly generated and hidden in a draw pile, only revealed when the lead car advances from the known course. The player whose car first crosses the finish line wins.

Name: Frigid Fight
Description:
You are stuck on an island together, but the boat only fits one... You will have to kill everyone else, or, let them freeze to death on this extremely cold island before you escape...

Each character has abilities to help them be the last man standing on the island. Choose what you use wisely, or, you might get killed when you are week...

Try to get the others lower then you, so they freeze first, then, when everyone else is dead, take you one man boat to a warm climate and be happy.

it will fill you with laughs when you are trying to survive against your friends, family, or loved ones. Just don't take it to seriously when they leave you to freeze alone...

—description from the publisher

Name: Sword for Hire: A Solo Dice Game
Description:
Solitaire dice game of fantasy combat. It only requires pen, paper, and 3 regular dice. The player controls a fantasy hero who is attemtping to defeat mighty villains and monsters.

Each Hero turn the player chooses to roll and reroll dice. The result of the dice forms a temporary pool of damage points. Certain combos grant special abilities, like double damage or parry.
When the player chooses the Strike action, the total from the temporary damage pool is applied to one of the enemies. The Hero's turn is then over.

If the player rolls a 1 for any reason, the attack is a miss, and there is no effect. The turn was wasted.

Next, the enemies attack - each in different ways depending on the scenario.

The player wins by defeating all monsters, and loses if the hero is killed.

—description from the publisher

Name: BOSS: Das verruckte Romme
Description:
This is a Rummy based game with several special features.

The game consists of 2 sets of cards valued 1 to 10 in each of four colours plus 24 "special" cards. The objective of the game is to get rid of all your cards by creating runs and/or sets ("sets" means either from now on) of at least 3 cards and playing them in front of other players so becoming penalty points that count against those players.

There are several sorts of Joker that may be used to make up the 3+ cards sets. "Double" and "Triple Jokers" double and triple the value of the sets they are in.

There are 8 "Pass the set" cards that enable a player to pass any one set in front of them on to another player with the exception of sets containing a "Super Joker".

There are 4 "Take it Back" cards that can be used to immediately counter the "Take it Back" cards.

A deal finishes when any one player succeeds in reducing their hand to zero cards. All players score and record the value of the cards in front of them and in their hand. A game consists of 5 deals, the winner being the player with least penalty points.

Name: Ember: Obsidian Protocol
Description:
Obsidian Protocol is a squad-based, mecha-themed tactical miniature wargame set in the near future. Players assume the role of squad commanders, leading powerful mechs and drones into 1v1 battles and multiplayer skirmishes. All mech components are modular, granting players unparalleled flexibility in designing the perfect squad for the mission at hand. Thanks to an innovative initiative system, combat in Obsidian Protocol is fast-paced and brutal, and every turn offers new tactical choices on the path to victory.
Obsidian Protocol has four different modular sectors. For instance, mecha (as the biggest and core modular sector, it has three kinds of mechas itself. you have different ways to control them.),hive mind, ship and army. Each modular sector can be a unique game. Players can also choose two or more modular sectors to play, which brings better game experience. The core parts of Obsidian Protocol are assembling and fighting. Different modular sectors have different ways of assembling. For example, players can use different parts to assemble a mecha or choose different types of arms, vehicles to form different armies to fight. After assembling, with the attribute the parts provide, players can create their own strategies, brings more fun to the game. No game board is used, players make or purchase their own scenery.
Different from most war-games, you can make only one action such as movement, melee combat, ranged combat not a series of actions in a round. We will use inch rulers to decide movement range, weapon range. Dices will be used to determine the damage.
One game usually last 45-90 mins. To win, the players need to act as commanders and accomplish quests under the obstruction of the enemies with your squad or just kill them all.

Name: Can you hear me
Description:
Read facial expression of characters, do they match with the story? Sometimes, it is not so easy to tell the delicate differences of emotions and sympathy.

“Can you hear me?” is an emotional training game that is developed to exercise social coping skills by empathizing with other people’s feelings.

Facial expression is an important element of reading emotions, and it is also a clue of mutual interaction that establishes the relationships with other people. Therefore, this game is designed to train general emotional system according to situations through storytelling, and to enhance the ability to build a social relation network.

It provides a training process to read emotions from character’s (four members of a family) facial expressions that fit the theme

[Winning the game]
The player who collects most of the tokens by reading emotions well wins the game. Each player should listen well to other players’ situation explanation, then look for the appropriate facial expression on the Emotion tiles that fits the story and place a token on that tile. It is not about one’s own feelings, but listening to other people's emotions and sympathizing and finding their faces on Emotion tiles accurately is what determines the victory.

Name: Danny Dux Space Race
Description:
Danny Dux has a fleet of spaceships in orbit around Mercury and wants to race them to Pluto. 
The game is a simple spin and move. With players traversing the solar system landing on each planet. They must spin a particular number to escape its velocity to proceed towards the next planet. A number of hazards can be encountered along the way, resulting in a lost turn or returning to a previous planet. First to arrive at Pluto by exact spin is the winner.

Produced as a promotional game by the Dux Stationary products,Tickle industries, Australia in 1958.

Name: Guerra de Mitos IX: Era Divina
Description:
Guerra de Mitos IX: Era Divina expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 150 cards split between the Hindu and Babylonic.

Era divina is the fist expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (War of the Myths) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Memoir '44: Through Jungle and Desert
Description:
Lead your men through the merciless jungles of Burma, trying to escape the Japanese grasp, or rush to Rangoon before the British forces evacuate the city on the jungle scenario. Then, change the terrain and fight the first tank battle between U.S. and German forces in the sands of North Africa, where Stuart and Panzer clash in the middle of the desert.

Through Jungle and Desert, the second installment in Days of Wonders' second series of Memoir '44 Battle Maps, includes six standard pre-printed scenarios with historical background and special rules, one token punchboard, and two new decks of combat cards: a Jungle Combat Cards deck and a Desert Combat Cards deck. The Jungle's scenarios can be played separately or as a campaign, with each scenario outcome impacting the following one.

In addition, this expansion features two pre-printed Overlord scenarios that allow you to fight for Henderson Field in Guadalcanal or conduct a a huge desert battle that marks the beginning of the second battle of El Alamein in Operation Lightfoot.

To use this expansion, you need at least one copy of Memoir '44 as well as the Pacific Theater and Mediterranean Theater expansions. The publisher also recommends the Terrain Pack and Equipment Pack expansions.
Families: Game: Memoir '44 – The Battle Map Series

Name: Guerra de mitos X: Legión Romana
Description:
Guerra de mitos X: Legión Romana expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 150 cards split with Rome mithology

Legión Romana is the second expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (War of the Myths) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Guerra de mitos XI: Genios y Ladrones
Description:
Guerra de mitos XI: Genios y Ladrones expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 165 cards split with Persian mythology.

Genios y Lasdrones is the third expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (Myths at War) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Guerra de Mitos XII: Primigenios en China
Description:
Guerra de mitos XII: Genios y Ladrones expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 165 cards split with Chinese and Elder Ones mythologies.

Primigenios en China is the third expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (Myths at War) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chiffre
Description:
Inspector Wolf is under pressure: Only if he can decipher the darn secret word will he be able to understand the entire message from the Mafia boss Volpone. Time is short since Volpone could also intercept the inspector's latest message to his informant — and if the mafioso is the first to crack Wolf's password, the inspector's informant would be in extreme danger.

Who will be the first to figure out his opponent's secret word in Chiffree? Time is running out!

Name: Guerra de Mitos XIII: Era Mortal
Description:
Guerra de Mitos XIII: Era Mortal expands Myths at War, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 165 cards split with Celtic mithology and some Heroes out from Mythsgate (one of GDM Releases for 2018)

"Era Mortal" is the second expansion of the fouth age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (Myths at War) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Environmental Rescue Game
Description: Environmental themed roll-and-move game. Collect points as you move along the board, highest total at the end wins.

Name: 1859: High Tide of the Second Empire
Description:
"1859: High Tide of the Second Empire" is a two-player wargame simulation dealing with the Franco-Austrian War in Northern Italy in 1859.  One player controls the forces of France and Piedmont-Sardinia and the other player controls the forces of Austria and its potential allies.  Using a shared deck of Operations Cards, each player makes decisions concerning the deployment, combat and political-military operations in support of his forces and his general strategy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Archie: Running 'Round Riverdale
Description:
Running 'Round Riverdale has everyone playing their favourite characters from the Archie comics. The dismissal bell has rung at Riverdale High, and players try to outwit each other as they race to be the first to reach Pop Tate's Choclit Shoppe. The best part is you get to choose from 18 characters to build your own gang of three to race for the win!

Players use cards to move forward or backward spaces and movement cards can also be played on other players.  Special cards can be played to send players back to their home position, swap places with the lead player, re-shuffle all the cards and other "Dirty Tricks" that keep the whole gang guessing.

The first player to get all three of their friends around the board and into Pop Tate's Choclit Shoppe is the winner.  But it's not easy because entering the finish line has to be done on an exact count, so managing your cards is important!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ta-Ku
Description:
Ta(ble) Ku(bb) is a table version of the outdoor game Kubb also known as Viking Chess. Ta-Ku is played with dice and small wooden blocks.

Whilst in the traditional Kubb you score by knocking down the wooden blocks of your opponent and finally the "king", in Ta-Ku you throw, roll or flip dice at small wooden blocks. You win the game by counting the values of the dice which successfully knocked down an opponent's block AND stayed within the borders of the field.

The game is played over three matches, the team or player with the highest score in the end wins.

—description from the designer

Name: En Blanc et Noir
Description:
ç™½ã¨é»’ã§ ("En Blanc et Noir") is a pattern matching card game with a deck of black or white cards, each with a pattern on the face. On their turn players take two actions, either drawing a card, playing a card face down onto the "map", or playing a card in front of them face up that has a pattern matching the map for points.
The game ends at the end of the turn that the last card is drawn. Players add up the cards played in front of them, minus the cards left in their hands, plus a bonus for certain cards matching the color found the most in the map, and the highest total wins.

Not to be confused with ç™½ã¨é»’ã§ãƒˆãƒªãƒ† (Trick-Taking in Black and White), a very similar looking and titled game from the same publisher.

Name: Desert Campaign:  North Africa 1941-42
Description:
Free print-and-play.

Division and independent brigade level - few units and fast play - 7.5mis/12kms per hex which is larger than AH's Afrika Korps.  Campaign game has 4 11x17/A3 component mapsheets perfect for the scale.  Campaign game has 45 half-month turns - IIFeb41-IIDec42 - and could be long, but many turns may be spent just fortifying and rebuilding, as historically.

There are also excerpted subgames - gamelets - of individual battles with individual maps for half-hour lunch games.

Features a preliminary tank vs. (anti-)tank combat (table) *matrix* customized against the German/Italian panzer/tank regiments/division constants by Allied tank types.  (Allies get to start with British A13 cruisers.  :-) ) Of course, if the 88s score a hit on defense - first, with their long range -  they can (Disrupt or) kill any tank/armoured brigade indiscriminately, especially if it isn't supported by a support group's 88-suppressing artillery.

Previously Disrupted (during tank/anti-tank phase) panzer/armor units forced to retreat from their battlefield in the following general combat are not recovered - are instead lost/eliminated.

Otherwise, game is classically simple/abstracted - no airpower (necessary).  Supply is abstracted as well and also modeled by unit replacement/rebuilding abilities.

Axis units hidden (except when engaged), unless/until they get to Alamein at which time Monty takes control and the intelligence advantage is reversed.

Simple strategic withdrawal/bugout - "Gazala Gallop," "Matruh Stakes" - rule.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: SPLAT!!!
Description:
Are you ready for some Paintball action but you can’t get to the park? Then come and join the Kids of Patterson Street in their debut game SPLAT!!!

In SPLAT!!! You have to out play your opponents using the four cards in your hand to scheme and outsmart your fellow players. Once you get covered in paint, you will be eliminated from the game and have to watch the action of your fellows. But, don’t think that you have to survive until the end to win. The other way to end is just like the game Connect Four and get four matching colors in a row. That will automatically win you the game. You can play with a single buddy or grab an entire gang of eight and settle down for some quick and easy fun.

Name: Super Hazard Quest: Single-Player and Ghost House Expansion
Description:
This expansion contains Single Player Mode (SPM) as well as a new Dungeon Card. The Spooky Study Dungeon Card is not exclusive to SPM and may be played with MagiBot, or in a standard multi-player game.

Designed for SPM and Co-Op mode, MagiBot 2.0 takes turns with his opponent(s) and plays to win based on the information in the included instructions.

MagiBot seeks the same goal as every other player. That is, he attempts to defeat a Crystal Mini-Boss and deliver that Crystal to the matching Scrambler. Like other players, MagiBot has his own turn but always goes last.

Name: Die Mond Rakete
Description:
A simple roll and move game where players travel race from the earth to the moon. 
Players choose their course by the roll of the dice, with 1 and 2 travelling along a black path, 5 and 6 along a red path and 3 and 4 along a yellow path. Along the way various challenges are encountered such as faulty air supply in the rocket or not enough acceleration to leave earth and penalties are applied.
Players pass through the constellations on route to the moon and landing on certain numbers assists or hinders the players progress. 
Landing on the moon is accomplished by throwing a 6 on the dice. First to land on the moon is the winner.
The game was published by the Fritz Homann A.G company of Germany who produced a few board games to promote their Fri-Ho-Di margarine brand.

Name: Magorum
Description:
Magorum is an exciting, fast-paced customizable fantasy card game where players take the roles of powerful Mages that do battle by casting incredible spells, perform enchantments, conjure up magical items, and even call forth powerful incantations. The big difference is that in Magorum the player doesn’t control any units such as monsters or robots or fighters. Instead, YOU are the center of the battle and you use YOUR power to perform amazing feats of magic and destruction in order to defeat the opponent. The only permanent cards on the field are the magical items that empower the player. In this fast-paced magical warfare, players have to use wit and strategy to overpower their opponent.

The main box set consists of 200 different cards which are divided into 5 different schools of magic: Ignogan (Fire), Aqualibrium (Water), Winderis (Air), Terrakov (Earth) and Gromnik (Electricity). Players can mix and match cards from different schools to create their ideal deck.

The players mix and match cards from each school to create a deck of 57 cards, and a side-deck of up to 7 cards. The players then take turns placing cards in the manapool and using the mana they've accumulated to cast spells and deal damage. Each point of damage equals 1 card discarded from the top of the opponent's deck.

The goal of the game is to deal enough damage to the opponent to discard all of the cards from their deck, thus winning the duel!

—description from the designer

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Return to the Night of the Zealot
Description:
You swore that you would never go back. Yet like a snake eating its own tail, you were always meant to return to where it all began. In the Arkham Horror: The Card Game Core Set, Night of the Zealot presented your first challenge while introducing you to the investigators, mechanics, and environment of Arkham Horror Files, providing a stable foundation from which you built you investigations into the unknown and the unknowable. Now, you are invited to return home and begin a new challenge worthy of your expertise.

Return to the Night of the Zealot is an expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game that enhances and modifies the Night of the Zealot campaign with 46 new Encounter cards and 20 new Player Cards. Additionally, this expansion includes a premium box and 18 divider cards to hold your entire Night of the Zealot campaign.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Zero
Description:
Discard all the cards before the other players.

In the basic game, the cards are divided equally among 4 colours (red, blue, yellow, green) and 4 characters (mom, dad, male puppy and female puppy.) You can discard a card just if it follows one of these two simple rules:

     You can discard a card of a colour on one of the same colours;
     You may discard a card with a certain character on one that depicts the same character.


Characters are identified both for their clothes and for a typical object (shown at the top left of the card).
Other characterizing elements are the number of fingerprints and the number in the upper right, which will become relevant only for older children.

The player who first discards all their cards wins.

In the Advanced game, you can also play with special cards with funny effects:
We advise you to insert them gradually in 3 progressive steps, but you are absolutely free to introduce them in an order chosen by you, perhaps by reason of the younger players' preferences towards a character rather than another. All special cards have a bottom part with showing colours on which they can be played, and an upper part which shows their effect on the next player's turn. The only exception is the wolf, which has a special effect. 
The Special cards are organized in three difficulties steps. This allows to introduce into the game the complexity by following the need of the children.

Name: Tally Ho! Tactical Air Combat Game, Allies vs Axis 1939-1942
Description:
Tally Ho! is volume 5 in the Battle over Britain game series, covering North Africa, 1940-41. In addition, it contains warplanes and six other campaign games featuring Italy, Britain, Germany, the USA, Japan, AVG China, Poland, and the Netherlands from 1939-1942... 119 warplanes in all.  It also provides six new "stand alone" scenarios--a first for the system--such as Rommel himself trying to escape behind lines in a Storch, or a short campaign scenario pitting a single Chennault's Fighting Tiger (without spare parts) against the Japanese, or flying against an Me-109 on escort duty (rather than on its own), and more.  Also new is guidelines/formula for rating the value of warplanes yourself, based on game ratings, to allow for more in-depth comparison of aircraft.

The game system is identical to and compatible with Battle over Britain. This 52-page full color, illustrated book includes standard rules, advanced rules, solitaire rules, and historical scenarios.  In fact, the aircraft and campaign games include those contained in Battle over the Pacific (Vol. 2), Faith, Hope & Charity (Vol. 3), and Flying Tigers (Vol. 4). (See descriptions below for details.) This edition is a handsome volume and comes with new North African and  Additional Plane counters, featuring aircraft new to the system, plus others such as the RAF Battle and Hudson, the Italian C-32 and SM-82, American P-38 Lightning, Australian Boomerang,  and German Storch and Ju-52 Tante Ju.  Also included is a "points system" for rating planes (or design-your-own scenarios), and new stand-alone game scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tossed Together
Description:
Tossed Together is a fun, high energy, word guessing party game.

Players work together as a team to give a clue to their teammate for a word that is on a card they've drawn. The catch is, teammates can only say one word of the clue at a time!


     The first guesser draws a card and holds it so the other players can see the card, but the card’s information is hidden from the guesser.
     Starting with the player to the left of the guesser, the other players on this team give a clue to the guesser “One Word At A Time”
     If the players giving the clue break any clue rules, the team loses one point and a new card is drawn.
     When any clue giving player feels the clue is complete, they ring the bell. Once the bell is rung, the guesser makes one guess trying to correctly identify what’s written on the card. 
     The card is scored: A correct guess is worth one point. An incorrect guess is not worth any points. 
     The player to the left of the guesser becomes the new guesser and play continues.
     When time runs out, continue the clue for the current card. After the guess is made, the round ends.


The team with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Suddenly Stoned
Description:
Take turns drawing cards that have simple tasks to complete but become increasingly difficult the higher a player is, such as "Correctly guess what time it is!" or "Call a family member!" Suddenly Stoned creates interesting conversations and delightful situations that will have you and your squishy-brained friends rolling around the floor in laughter.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Hold-Up
Description:
Elliot got out of jail and works at the gas station that belonged to his adoptive father. As a bandit, it is this place that you decide to rob ... and as much to tell you that you fall badly!

Luckily, Elliot has you in the right, and agrees to teach you the basics of the job. But before, you will have to prove yourself!

Choose the places to point, select your equipment and sharpen your skills to become the biggest gangster in the United States.

Hold-Up is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

Name: The Dark Mage
Description:
Family, friends, moral sense, tranquility: you knew you had to lose everything in exchange for forbidden magic. But now you must obey the whims of a demon prince ... You will have to leave your den, avoid the inquisitors and use your powerful spells to face many dangers. Is your soul permanently corrupt or is there another way? Your destiny will depend on your choices, because the hero is you!

Magica Tenebrae is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

Name: ¡Adiós Calavera!: Character Expansion ¡Hasta Nunca!
Description:
¡Adiós Calavera!: Character Expansion ¡Hasta Nunca! adds 2 new characters. Their abilities can only be used once during the game.

Gonzales/Graciano - The Freeloader: When calculating the movement points for him count pieces of the opponent double.

Liberta/Lorena - The Social One: She determines her movement points according to the normal ability. After she has moved, the player may move another one of their pieces with the same number of movement points. Any special abilities of the second piece may not be used.

Name: Hocus & Pocus: Duo de Choc
Description:
Blanche Snow is worried: her 7 cousins, who work in the Hého mine, have not returned from work ... She gives you the mission to find them. Fortunately, Mamypom, his magic mirror and your fabulous creatures will help you! Play the role of Hocus and Pocus, solve puzzles, choose the right paths, collect objects and stars, for the success of your mission!

Hocus & Pocus is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

Name: Thomas the Tank Engine Action Game
Description: Move passengers from the waiting room to a station. Use your train to pick up your colour, then move to the next station. First player to pickup all their passengers win.

Name: Zombie!
Description:
The zombies are coming! No one has anticipated their arrival, and for good reason ... they are your neighbors, your friends, your family. In this apocalyptic adventure, you play the brave Judy, whose mission is to help the population escape the ghouls, without being bitten herself. Unless you choose to play Ben, an unfortunate zombie forced to devour alive, without being killed.

Are you ready for anything to survive?

Zombies is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

Name: Flying Saucer Spelling Game
Description:
The game consists of an outer circular board that has a rotating inner circle. The inner circle has some sci fi graphics and along its edges it has the alphabet and letter blends. Rotating the inner circle helps players makes words using the outer circular board.
The starting player turns the outer circle 5 combinations to randomly select a letter combination (i.e eep). the player then uses the inner circle of letters and blends to try and make as many words possible (i.e Keep or sheep). For each correct letter- sound combination players receive 5 points. Penalties of 10 points apply for any omitted words or incorrect words. 
Players take turns until 5 sound combinations are completed. The player with the most points is the winner.
The game is really to help children learn to read and spell.

—user summary

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2010
Description:
The 2010 Core Set features 249 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set. It is available in booster packs, intro packs, and fat packs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Journey through Space Game
Description: Simple roll and move game travelling from earth to an inhabited star. Spaces are marked 1 to 100 with specialized spaces to help in the journey and others to penalize the players. First to reach the inhabited star is the winner.

Name: Bingo Dice
Description:
There are 3 dice with 18 symbols and 3x3 bingo sheets.
Roll all dice and place the tokens on the matching symbols.
Who get all 9 symbols on his/her sheet is the winner.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – 2013 Core Set
Description:
The Magic 2013 Core Set features 249 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ragnarök: Destiny of the Gods
Description:
Ragnarok - Destiny of the Gods is an exciting card game for adults and children alike. The sixty-five cards each show one of the beings found in Norse mythology: gods, trolls, giants, animals, and more. For each, the card describes the being, their strengths and weaknesses, and their story. With the information on the card, you can play six fun and educational games. You can even play out Ragnarok!
—description from the back of the box

Ragnarök – Destiny of the Gods. This is a unique intellectual work of Reynir A. Óskarson made from original sources. The deck of card is designed as an edutainment deck of cards and a souvenir
about Norse mythology, where the 65 cards describe all the main characters of the Norse mythology. In the deck, all the characters get points, showing their locations, influence, and power according to the original sources, and these points give people insight in how Nordic people saw the world in the age of the Vikings. It's even possible to play out the events of Ragnarök as they appear in the ancient texts of Völuspá and Gylfaginning!
—description from the publisher (English)

Ragnarök - Destiny of the Gods. Hér er um er að ræða einstakt hugverk Reynis A. Óskarssonar sem er í heild unnið upp úr frumheimildum. Spilið er hannað sem skemmtimenntunar (e. edutainment) spil og minjagripur um Norræna goðafræði, þar sem 65 spil fara yfir allar helstu kynjaverur goðafræðinnar. Í spilinu fá allar verurnar stig sem sýna staðsetningu þeirra og áhrifamátt samkvæmt upprunalegu heimildunum og gefur fólki innsýn í það hvernig norrænt fólk á víkingatímum sá heiminn. Það er meira að segja hægt að spila út Ragnarök eins og þau birtast í Völuspá og Gylfaginningu!
—description from the publisher (Icelandic)

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Ninth Edition Core Set
Description:
Ninth Edition Core Set was a "Core Set" expansion for Magic: The Gathering.

The expansion featured 350 cards. It also featured randomly inserted premium black-bordered versions of all cards in the set. There were also 9 fixed cards in the Core Game (Starter Set), which made the entire expansion set 359 cards.

Ninth Edition Core Set was sold in 15 Card Booster Packs (Random Cards), 5 Theme Decks, a Fat Pack, and a Core Game (2 Player Starter Set).

The 350 cards available in the Booster Packs included 110 Uncommon, 110 Common, 110 Rare, and 20 Basic Lands.

The Core Game (Starter Set) contained 2 x 33 Card Fixed Preconstructed Starter Decks to play a guided start game.  It also included a 14 Fixed Card Advanced Booster Pack.  The 14 card advanced booster pack was designed to be added to the two starter decks (7 cards each) to make 2 x 40 card decks for play after playing the guided start game.  The Core Game also included items like paper foldout playmats w/cardboard life counters, Player Guides to play the guided starter game, and a Rulebook to introduce new players to Magic: The Gathering.

The Core Game's two 40 fixed card decks included 64 cards from the main 350 expansion set, and 16 cards from 9 cards included only from the Core Game.

The 5 Theme Decks each had 40 Fixed Cards from the main 350 expansion set:


     Army of Justice (White)
     Custom Creatures (Green)
     Dead Again (Black)
     Lofty Heights (Blue)
     World Aflame (Red)

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Unglued
Description:
Unglued is the first silver-bordered Magic set. It includes 94 cards, of which only the land cards are tournament-legal.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Berlin
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Under the Sea
Description:
In the Basic Version, all the players work together in order to match all the animal shapes with the corresponding tile.
The player turns a tile face up showing it to all the other players.
Then, they insert their hand in the bag and search for the shown animal shape without looking into it, just through the touch. When they find the one they think is correct, they then take it out and show it to the other players.
If you managed to match all the animals with their tiles, then you win… Well done!

In the advanced version, the first player then tries to find the tile corresponding to the animal shape among those face down on the table; they then choose a tile and turn it face up.

The player who first manages to match all the animal shapes with
corresponding tile wins. Well done!

Name: Krimi total: Zum Geier mit dem Mord
Description:
General info on Krimi Total:
Murder mystery game in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery.

Info on this particular case:
„Zum Geier mit dem Mord“ takes place in lonely saloon in the Wild West. The murder of the saloon's owner has to be solved and a legend of an Indian treasure can be examined.

All players (3 male, 3 female + 1 m/f optional role) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ferengi Faction Pack
Description: The Independent Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Independent faction: two Ferengi D'kora class marauders, a Ferengi-comandeered B'rel class bird-of-prey, and a Ferengi shuttlecraft. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 27 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Data
Description:
This card is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Chronological Chaos."

Unique Federation Crew (5 SP)
As an action, you may discard Data and target an opposing ship within range 2.  You then roll an attack die to determine the effect.

Crit: Discard a card of your choice on the target ship.
Battle Stations: Discard the Captain of the target ship.
Hit: Discard a crew on the target ship.
Blank: Nothing.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Nanclus
Description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Chronological Chaos."

Unique Romulan Crew (5 SP)
As an action, you may discard Nanclus and target an opposing ship within range 3.  That ship rolls +1 attack die that round, but cannot roll defense.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Photonic Cannon
Description:
This card is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Trap Travesty."

Unique Federation Weapon (10 SP)
As an attack, you may spend your Target Lock token, remove the cannon from play, and suffer 2 damage to your hull to perform a 10 die attack at a target at range 3.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Romulan Pilot
Description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Trap Travesty."

Romulan Crew (2 SP)
As a free action, you may discard Romulan Pilot to place a Scan token beside your ship and perform a green maneuver.
